Even though it wasn't what I expected, it was still very good! My favorite part was the inside of the fried sticks which contained the mac and cheese. I kind of wished that the mac and cheese was just served regularly and not fried though because it was VERY rich and I actually didn't finish it all. I think the mac and cheese on its own was good enough to not need the fried outer coating.

I was very intrigued by the dessert menu, but was way too full after the rich food. If I had room though, it was a tie between the mocha milkshake with chocolate brownie and the donuts...they both looked delicious.

Fix was a good restaurant, it just wasn't great.  The server that we had seemed a bit miffed when I asked a question about the menu.  (How big are the lobster tacos?  Apparently, really small.)  I ended up ordering the spicy tuna on sticky rice cakes.  It was good, but I wasn't all that impressed.  I've had better elsewhere and less expensive.
Awesome dinner not insanely priced for a bellagio restaurant amazing service as well and love the ambiance here

We went here to get a few drinks at the bar and ended up having a few appetizers, too.  It was easy to get bar seats, the service was fast and friendly and it had a good crowd for people-watching: some were attractive and some were just interesting.

For food, my friend had sliders, which she really enjoyed, and I had the fried macaroni and cheese.  I didn't really pay attention to the "fried" part on the menu so I was a little surprised when I got these macaroni and cheese nuggets, but they were good.  It was a perfect light yet not really that healthy snack-y meal.  And, it went well with the drinks.  It's kinda pricey but I sort of expected that, although for five drinks and two fancy appetizers, it really was not that out of line for a more upscale lounge/bar/restaurant.  I would definitely return here for drinks and apps, and probably for dinner.

Meh, service was seriously lacking in a half full restaurant with the prices they are charging for food and drinks. Very disorganized staff. Inattentive and no follow ups whatsoever to see if all is fine. The restaurant somewhat loud and is basically on par with a sports bar with a restaurant too.

This place was pretty good.  It was one of the cheaper restaurants in Bellagio, though entrees were still $30-$60.  I ended up paying about $65 for shared appetizers and sea bass.

Now why would you want to pay $65 for a dinner when you can gamble outside, look at HOT people (girls are all fine and dressed up here), WIN $, and get FREE drinks (plus tips I guess)?  Well, you really shouldn't rely on alcohol for your daily calories.  Believe me, I've tried, and you feel pretty sick after over half a day.  Plus, the waitresses at Fix are dressed very nice and are CUTE.  The waiters come by and refill your water whenever it gets to its halfway point.  There's also trendy music bumping, so it's more for the younger crowd.  Have you ever been to a fancy ass restaurant where everyone dresses up, yet hip hop is bumping?  I think not.  Here's where you go for that divine experience.

Now on to the food.  For appetizers, my party of 7 shared the crabcakes and egg rolls.  The crabcakes were damn good, but a bit hard to maneuver.  It's doesn't have much girth, but is like 4 inches high.  So imagine stuffing that sucker down your throat (I know, I know, I couldn't resist with the terminology).  Great nonetheless.  The egg rolls were alright, I probably wouldn't order it again.  The sea bass I ordered was very fresh and good.  It doesn't beat the super oily ones in upscale Chinese restaurants I've been to, but I definitely didn't feel ripped off.  My friend order mashed potatoes, which was VERY VERY good.

All in all a very good experience and a "budget" restaurant, if you will, at the Bellagio.

What a terrible experience!! The service was absolutely horrible, it took an hour just to get drinks. The food was extremely over-priced... I paid $60 for a small steak, and it was definitely not worth it. I had 'checked in' here on Yelp to get some special fix menu, but the server would not honor it (the first time I asked he kind of rolled his eyes, the second time he said they would not let me do it after 7!?! There was nothing that said anything about times).   

It's too bad, I'm a local and I simply LOVE the Bellagio. I frequent Prime and the noodle place. But I will NEVER go back to FIX.
Great place to have a drink and eat with friends. I had some wine and steak and the mushrooms are amazing!

This is really a 2 1/2 stars...but I rounded up on this one.

I really wanted to like FIX. Took my parents here for Mother's Day. Ambiance was great. Our waiters were very attentive; always refilling our drinks, constantly coming to check up on us, they even took our pictures without hesitation. (That's the reason why I decided to bump this review to a 3 stars.)

Food-wise.....ehh...I've had better filet mignon and sea bass.

ITEMS WE ORDERED:

LOBSTER TACOS: came with 4 tacos. This was considered "sharable appetizers" but I got this as my entrée. The tacos were delicious. The flavoring and the salsa they give you are great pairings. For small eaters like myself, this would get you perfectly full.

10 OZ FILET MIGNON: ordered this medium well. Mom enjoyed it. It was cooked to her perfection. I had a couple pieces. Not as juicy or seasoned as I wanted my filet mignons to be. Like I said....I've had better.

SEABASS: It was good...but lacking in flavor. The sea bass was on a thick layer of Risotto. Risotto is an Italian rice dish cooked in broth to a creamy consistency.

As our side dish, we got their special of the day. Buttered mashed potatoes with crab meat mixed inside. Parents got a few bites...I ate most of it. I'm a HUGE FAN of potatoes so this was delicious for me. Perfect when it's pippin hot.

All in all, FIX was such a disappointment. Wanted to like this restaurant but it wasn't all that great. =/

Went here on a Thursday night for a company dinner. The ambiance and people watching at this spot is great although it is a little dark on the inside.

Onto the food. We had the lobster tacos, the calamari, and the Kobe chili cheese fries. The tacos and the calamari were great. The calamari actually is probably some of the best I've had. The tacos were fresh and filled with lobster but really small. For $24 I'd probably choose something different next time. The chili cheese fries were disappointing and were our least favorite app.

I went with the 28 day dry aged ribeye for my entree. The glaze on the steak was great and the steak was cooked perfectly. A very good quality steak but if you're going out specifically for steak there are better Vegas options. I still felt very satisfied with my order though.

For the sides we had the very adult mac and cheese and the smoked mashed potatoes. Both were outstanding. I'd come back to this restaurant for the mac and cheese alone and the mashed potatoes tasted like they'd been smoked for hours in my smoker. 

We had the bread pudding, doughnuts, and the s'mores for dessert. Bread pudding was the table favorite and the doughnuts were our least favorite.

All in all Fix is a little on the pricier side but you get that you pay for. The quality of the food and the creativity of the chef make Fix and good place to check out if you're hungry in the Bellagio.

Fix is all about the service, and the food is excellent!  We ordered alot of different dishes, and ate them all!  They have deep friend mac and cheese, lobster tacos, spicy tuna bites, great steak, and i got the kobe sliders 3 way!  Everything was great, and the service was truly Phenomenal!  Not once was my water low, and because they apologized for the food being a little late (we didnt even notice) they gave us dessert on the house.  Not 1 but 3! Their bread pudding is delish! creme brule with chocolate, and the fresh doughnuts with dipping sauce.  I will be back for sure!  Amazing, its a shame not all vegas restaurants can compete with the food and service i experienced  here

Wonderful! Our experience was well worth the money we paid. We had beautifully prepared meals and the service was superb! I would definitely recommend this restaurant and I will return when I am back in town!

I have been to FIX many times and was lucky enough to dine here last Saturday again.  We typically sit in the bar/lounge and love to get a seat along the edge where we can watch people come in and out of the Bellagio.  Obviously, the people watching on a Saturday night is primo!

So....after much thought, I started with the cucumber martini.  I love cucumber martinis, so the thought involved whether I wanted to pay $20 for a martini. Yes, $20.  However, I must say it was a huge, fabulous treat with a long skewer of cherry tomatoes and sliced cucumber sticking out of it.  Totally worth the price.  

It was the second or third time I indulged in the sliders.  They are delicious, and I love the little jar of ketchup that is included.  We also ordered the steak fries that have cheese and truffle oil  and the adult mac and cheese.  All were fabulous, and it was actually too much food! 

Four stars rather than five due to the service.  We waited a good 10-15 minutes before our server acknowledged us.  This is one of my biggest pet peeves.  She was very friendly but not very attentive.  Not sure how this happens with a business that is busy every single night all year long!  The service should be better.

This is where Derek Zoolander eats. 

Came after watching "O" and the music was bumping and the lights were dimmed.  Young hotties eating at each table, I definitely felt out of place...especially when the hostess gave my outfit the once over and let me stand at the counter for 10 minutes before telling me she was looking for a table for me.

Once sat, our server was really friendly but definitely looked stressed.  I don't know why, but I felt that every server/busboy looked like they were rushing around.  Too many tables for each of them?  

We settled for the kobe sliders, cold seafood appetizer, and lobster tacos for our "meal".   BTW it took them 10 minutes to get back to us to take our order after we told them we were ready. 

The lobster tacos are TINY but very flavorful.  The cold seafood appetizer is tiny as well but very fresh.  The kobe slider are delicious...but I love any burger.  Too bad they cooked it well done when I asked for medium rare. 

After you order, a busboy is pretty quick at taking away your plates and refilling your water but our server constantly looked busy.  

Overall the food is MEH and after spending over $100 bucks at this place I felt like I stepped into an overpriced, loud, snobby nightmare.

Don't miss the Kale Salad. Nice balance of anchovies and lemon. Pork Shank was the crispest and tender, Lobster Tacos were delicate and perfect with all the plates. I'd come back just for the Tuna on Rice cakes. FIX showed off with celebrating Dad 'a 81st Bday with their addicting donuts to end the night.

Received a message from the general manager that I was sent a private message to discuss the poor experience I had. NO MESSAGE. Not a surprise the service is extremely sub-par. This falls in line with my entire experience at FIX.

They are located on side of casino so you wouldn't expect to have great steak. Their steak is ten times better than Ruth Chris and other high end steak houses I've been at. 

Service was excellent. Was short on time and our server got 3 steak orders out in ten minutes cooked perfectly. This was without any advance tip.  I have them 90 tip on 220 bill. 

Highly recommend their steaks.

Well my husband and I dined here last Wednesday night on a whim originally were going to prime but they did not have any open reservations until 9 PM that night made 730 reservations with concierge arrived a couple minutes late but we were promptly seated by a gorgeous hostess! This place is beautiful on the inside but of course very expensive but it's a big ass what do you expect food was delicious and we had a nice waitress who is pretty attentive.. overall I would recommend coming here if you're close by

Yummy!!!!  We enjoyed everything we had to eat here.  The adult Mac N cheese was amazing!!  My favorite part was dessert, smores in a cup!!  I would come back here just for that.  Service was top notch.  My only (mild) complaint was still being able to smell smoke from the casino.  I know, its Vegas, there will be smoke.  I just wish I didn't smell it while eating.
Best restaurant in town!!  Go see Heather at the bar, BEST bartender EVER!!!  Spicy Tuna and The Lobster Tacos are amazing! Will come back every time we are in The Sin City!
The food had fantastic flavor and the staff worked well together.  I was along with the rest of our group a bit disappointed at how long it took to get our check after we asked for it.
Bone in rib eye over cooked. Pork medallions were cold and small. Drinks were weak. Waiter turned us over to a nice apologetic gentleman. Disappointed

Enjoyed a couple of drinks and a light meal here last night. The only complaint I can make is the top piece of the bun on my sliders was way too dry. I understand everyone has their own preferences, but for me, the top bun was too thick and dry for my liking. On the flip side, the cocktails were delish, and the truffle fries are a must!

words can not do this amazing establishment justice you have to experience this wonderful mix of high energy atmosphere and top of the line cuisine as they are merged together for a ONE OF A KIND dinning experience.. Located in the heart of the most exquisite hotel on the strip in the #Bellagio
Fantastic! If you're drinking wine, get a glass of the prisoner. Service is wonderful and the ambiance is very well, Vegas.

Ate here for a Bachelorette dinner on a Friday night. We made reservations in advance and were seated once we arrived - perfect if short on time for a show. Our waiter (oops I didn't get his name) was fun, energetic and very informative. He was happy to answer all our entree questions throughout ordering, and took a few group pictures for us at the end. 

Most of the girls, ordered the Roasted Scallops and were pleased. A perfect portion and filled with flavor! For salad lovers - the KALE CEASAR!!! One of the girls, ordered the Seabass Risotto, but it came out cold. The waiter quickly took it back and took care of it. The manager then came by to make sure everyone was OK and sent us a round of complimentary coffee-like shots. Definitely a trendy, cozy, romantic spot. Plenty of bar room for those dining solo.

The location is beautifully decorated and dark. The drinks were delicious. The NYC strip was spot on cooked perfect medium. Add the red wine sauce and you are in heaven! And of course, the adult am and cheese takes the cake. Moderate pricing for Vegas, but lacked the WOW!

The Bellagio is one of the nicest casinos, but the FIX isn't one of the nicest restaurants in Vegas.  The food was good but extremely overpriced, but I expected a lot more from this place.  I had the Chilean sea bass - which was really good, but I've had better at lesser restaurants.  The drinks were $10+ a piece, but I guess that's normal for Vegas prices.  The rest of the party got awesome steaks, while the poorer members got pizza.  The pizza was the cheapest item on the menu, and honestly it looked like the biggest rip off.

Take the money you were willing to spend for dinner and put it all on a hand of blackjack.  Go to dinner if it hits.  Otherwise, go to Sandwich of Earl and get an awesome $5 sub.

Ok so hear me out on the 3 stars. I've been here about at least 5 times now because it's convenient if you are at the Bellagio and we absolutely love the chicken wings, sliders and "Barbie tacos" as we like to call them. They are all so good and tasty and even worth the price. The atmosphere is good and we love to sit and watch people walk by. (Although those front benches are about as comfortable as sitting on a bed of nails and I'm being nice.)

If we love the food and atmosphere, then why only 3 stars? Well I'll tell you....the service! It's quite amazing that no matter when we come or whomever is our server, I'm pretty sure they are hired right off the model runway. They just keep getting better and better looking. While I can appreciate a pretty face and a short skirt, I loathe bad service, especially while in the customer service capital of the world. 

If we're willing to drop $700-$1000 on food and drinks in an hour, I think it's not too hard to refill our water or give us a napkin. Maybe ask us if we need anything instead of us having to wave the server down like an airplane flagger? 

The owners may want to consider hiring some ugly people and maybe they'll work a little harder for that tip instead of expecting it.

Excellent menu and unique decor. Sits you right next to the Bellagio foot traffic minus the awkwardness. 

We explored the Chef's ingenuity tapas style (which was perfect portion at 11.30pm after 4 cocktails). 

Recommended items to try: 
1) Spicy tuna 
2) White truffle pasta with penne
3) Sliders

This was possibly the worst meal I have had in Las Vegas in the last 25 years.  We went on December 31, 2016.  The food quality was horrible and the service was not much better.  To add insult to injury we dropped over $200.  Never again!
Absolutely delicious! Got the Fatchoy burger and pork belly bao. Totally the best burger I've ever had and the bao was indescribably delicious!! 5 stars +++ on the food.

went there with a bachelorette party of 8. we were seated very promptly. the 2 waiters we had were good, attentive. it's extremely packed and noisy so if you don't like that, don't go there. we got the bachelorette package for $55 a person (includes dinner, entry into caramel and the bank). seems like a popular thing being that there were a million other bachelorette groups there as well.

overall the food was good...i was satisfied. this is what we had:

yellowtail sashimi: good, nothing to rave about

Bills spicy tuna: loved it. sits on this crispy rice thing yet somehow melts into your mouth with sweet, garlicky flavor. delicious!

baby lettuce salad - this one i did not care for. salad greens with the occasional strawberry and hearts of palm tossed in a lemon vinagrette thing i didn't like. not much flavor, just sour. i think it would've been better with a balsamic vinagrette. 

kobe beef sliders with fries - good. can't think of anything else to say though. juicy?

entrees and sides:

seabass - 6 out of 8 got this.  i thought it was good, but i didn't love it. everyone else LOVED it. i liked how the fish was warm, flaky, yet silky. it sat on a shrimp risotto thing with lobster broth. i think it needed just a tad bit more flavor. i'm a little picky with fish.

2 of the girls got roasted chicken which they said was good. it looked good.

adult fried mac and cheese - when being cheesy is awesome! this was amazing. it comes lightly fried in the shape of a stick of butter with more cheese sauce on the side. it was lightly crisp on the outside, warm and of course cheesy on the inside. very tasty 

lobster mash (we ordered this extra on the side) - fluffy creamy mashed potatoes. has a different flavoring to it, but tasted more like bacon and something else than lobster, but was good...i approve.

dessert - 

donuts with chocolate and peanut butter sauce thing - i'm not a big fan of old fashioned donuts, but this was not too bad. it was stuffed with bananas. obviously fried but not too greasy. i couldn't finish it because i was stuffed.

drinks: expensive $14 a cocktail, but i guess that's normal vegas prices

passion fruit mojitos - loved it. refreshing, fruity, pulpy, just plain good.
pineapple mojito - not as good as passion fruit, but still good.

Slick, lounge style dining in the middle of the bellagio. It's dark, the music is loud, the food is outrageously expensive, Vegas baby!  A pretty creative menu all things considered. U gotta try the hot wing lollipops and scallops. Everything we had illicited rave reviews. Definitely a place for a group on the town...

I've hit FIX every time I've visited Vegas. It's an absolutely perfect go-to spot when hitting the Bellagio for same gambling. I've always sat in the bar/lounge area which is super duper for people watching. How do cowboys take themselves seriously and why do dudes from LA all wear shirts with dragons eating birds eating butterflies? But I digress...

Kobe Cheese Fries are a must. Had the beef carpacio on last visit and was some of the best I've had. Lobster tacos were good.. but they're cold (on purpose). Was expecting warm. Crab cake sliders wash everything down nicely.

Waitresses are top notch, grade A, government certified talent. Oh, and they're pretty good at serving things, too.

It is a little pricey (it's all relative tho), but it is fantastic. My hubby and I shared a 14 oz steak and baked potatoes. The portion was quite large and easily fed two ppl. We also had the calamari as an appy. Would definitely come back, but there are so many places to enjoy here that we may not make it. 

What I liked most, was getting a reso with short notice for some fantastic food!

Thanks Fix!

I took my parents to fix last time they came into town.  Fix always looks like a buzzing place and the ambience is great.  When you walk into the flamingo valet at belugio, fix is one of the first restaurants that you see, right across from yellowtail.  The service was great but my only gripe is the small portions and price. 

This place is grossly overpriced for what you get.  Most glasses of wine are over 20 dollars and were 3/4 pours.  The food dishes were tiny and I had to eat two entrees to get full.  I will say the food was tasty but literally our 3 lobster tacos (23 dollars for 2 in tacos) combined were smaller than one of my hands.  

I liked the boy baldwin burgers (comes in the form of small sliders), lobster tacos, adult mac and cheese was delicious, and the banana doughnuts were phenomenal.  I was satisfied with the taste of all of the food, but the portions and price completely blew it for me.  

I will not be coming back to fix.  There are much better options in the Belagio.

spent so much money with my friends for dinner . The food was very not fresh. I had a piece of salmon and it tadted really bad. I belive ot was a  frozen salmon. 
I'll never come here again!

Arrived Vegas a little late and had hard time finding a decent dining place without reservation, but FIX took us right in.  My wife ordered scallops and I did Stake and Lobster - yeah, I was hungry. 

Waiters were professional and foods were fantastic even though I was hungry.  Only reason for three stars was LOUD MUSIC, indeed.  Asked to turn down a little, but nicely ignored.  Most guests were mid to seniors, but music was like hard rock cafe.  My wife and I had to shout (yell to be exact) each other.

If you wish a quiet dinning place, this is definitely avoiding place.  A little dark too.  Price was alright for the quality food.  Everything's good and could be near perfect unless too loud and weird sound of music.....

I'm going to call this literally the best meal I've ever had, and we didn't even do appetizers. It is that good. A friend and I split the special of the night, which was the 2 lb Porterhouse and a 2 lb Brown butter stuffing-Crab stuffed lobster for $160, Which for the decadent meal we so thoroughly enjoyed was well worth it. This place has an intimate vibe, and knockout dishes, All 7 of us left satisfied and extremely pleased with the experience. When I'm in Vegas next I'll be back for sure.

I went here for a late night dinner..as appetizers we had the fanny bay oysters deeelish :] 

I ordered the scallops 'benedict', it came with 3 scallops and I could only eat 1 1/2 because it was just so rich that it was almost sickening to take another bite.  I tried their steak and meh.. I think the steak I make at home is more flavorful.  :/

I enjoyed my seat however, b/c it allowed me to people watch while eating.  Vegas sure does have characters,  I saw gold diggers and their sugar daddies, Asian hookers/"escorts" and their "dates", club goers, Ed Hardy douchebags.... and one girl wearing one of those flowy tops with the neckline that dips down to your navel, it wouldn't have stood out to me if she didn't have her unsecured flaps of what I guess were her breasts dangling like cow udders down to her navel.  

If you're not trying to have a romantic, sexy dinner, try to sit next to the blocky wall that opens up to the casino floor for some entertaining people watching.  :D

adult mac-n-cheese was my favorite thing at FIX. 

athough i ordered a brazed short ribs, steak, lobster mashed potatoes, and baby cheeseburgers all on different occasions. all things i would get again and recommend to friends!

never made it to the full menu at FIX during the dinner time mostly got some snacks before the club when they had a smaller menu.

staff here is so-so

I had Lobster tacos to start- they were delicious!  Tried the flatbread and it was great too.  You could make a meal out of the appetizers!  The service was excellent and so was all the food.  The manager stopped by the table to check on us which I thought was very professional of him.  Definitely will be back!
Try the cucumber martini, adult Mac n cheese, and the scallops Benedict and I promise you won't be disappointed!

Food Report:
If I hadn't started with the salad I would have enjoyed my meal much more - the salad had a slight fishy flavor... and I don't like fish. On the flip side, the kobe beef sliders were fantastic, and the fried mac and cheese was evil deliciousness. The service was friendly and good enough.

Fashion Report:
Not that it should keep you from eating there, but the outfits the girls are required to wear are borderline absurd. The plain black dresses aren't nearly flashy enough to be Vegas-slutty-chic, and aren't made up of enough material to qualify as something that could actually be called clothing. I have to believe their underwear alone would have been less revealing, somehow, and certainly more flattering - bravo to the designer who created a simple, black "dress" that all at once shows too much back, chest, stomach, legs, butt crack AND cheeks! Hats off, really! The casino cocktail waitresses at Binions looked more dignified. To the point, just ill-paired for the restaurant's elegant decor.

Nice appetizers. We wanted to grab a quick bite before a show and the menu was pretty broad, with stuff for everyone. Wait staff was courteous and attentive and the food was fast and very good. Really can't ask for more.

A 4-star meal for sure, but the prices are ridiculous, so know that coming in. When they pull the ol' "no prices on the online menu" trick, you know your wallet is in for a hit.

Items ordered... 
Finger Lickin' Fix - Lollipop wings and lots of em. They were little one bite wonders. A great starter if you're hanging at the bar. 
Kale Caesar - Served in a nice wooden bowl, this salad was delish. The kale was crisp and the addition of a lemon slice and some parmesan cheese really worked well with the dressing. 
Roasted Scallops - One of those items that comes out and you say, 'Hm. This is it?!', but in the end you finish the plate and it couldn't be any more perfect. Served with a great crust and some light nuts and cauliflower to place on top. Yum. 

Sticker shock? Yep. Worth the cash? I think so.

Fix's ambience is so-so. They would benefit from real walls (or tinted glass) to muffle some of the casino chatter and give it a real partitioned feeling. The sports game playing on the TV near us felt out of place, though a friend said it's likely someone was betting on the game and wanted to see its outcome.

Our group of six didn't have reservations, but we secured seating by the bar. Service was outstanding! Our servers (Monica and Candy) were attentive and friendly. Monica got us tasty shots - the one I remember was a lemon drop with blueberry. (As you may have read elsewhere, their waitstaff is indeed gorgeous. I freakin' giggled like a middle schooler when Monica flashed a smile in my direction.)

A few of us were recovering from a buffet earlier that day, so we went for side dishes and appetizers:
- The Bobby Baldwin Burgers ($25) - three kobe sliders (with cheddar, grilled onions, and spiced fries) - were excellent, moist, and flavorful. Wish I had some right now.
- I'm an oyster junkie, so I had to get their oysters ($3/oyster; East, West, and Speciality oysters available) were fresh and delicious.
- The Forks ($21) were a little cheesy (in both senses of the word) - smoked salmon, caviar poppers, scallion blinis. My least favorite, but still tasty.

I'd stop in again for the sliders, and perhaps their entrees (my one friend enjoyed his 20 oz. Ribeye ($49), and I trust his opinion). While the food was as pricey as I expected for a casino restaurant, the food TASTED better than I expected, even for the opulent Bellagio. Recommended for a try.

Wow. This meal was fabulous. Even more so because we were graciously offered to eat here for free (we paid for our drinks though). But man, were the expensive drinks worth it. Not only was the service quick and kind, but even though we were the youngest there and dressed up in our tightest and brightest, we were treated with respect, which is more than I can say for the other fancy restaurants around.

We got fries, lobster tacos, margarita pizza, green salad and the truffle penne. All of the dishes were incredible. The salad had a maple flavor to it and combined with the cheese and cashews, it was amazing. My favorite by far, though, was the truffle penne. I'm vegetarian but even without the prosciutto on it, it was seriously flawless and incredible. I'm looking for a recipe right now to try to recreate it. 

The ambiance is a little loud and dark for a more adult crew, but for us it was fine. I guess my only suggestion is that they tone down the dance music and the volume. Then it would be perfect for all customers.

Trendy but LOUD! I went for a bachelorette party and they were very accommodating with a set menu but the food was below par considering the prices. The yellowtail sashimi and sliders were good but my main entree, chilean sea bass, was horrible. Overall, I wasn't impressed.

I would say stick to the steaks.  They looked good.   I had the sea bass, which was not as favorable as I have in other restaurants of this price level.  Flavor was underwhelming. 

The mac and cheese sticks were amazing...highly recommend them.   

Overall, for the high price you pay here, I would rather be across the casino with at least a great view of the fountains.

This review is for Wed., Sept. 14th. I should have read other reviews before deciding to go here. I have to agree that it's only still open because of the location. I doubt few go back after the 1st time. Horrible service and food. 

Food - Chili Cheese Fries: Fries tasted like they had been cooked 3 days prior and stale. Cheese - not for sure exactly what it was but it was not cheese. I've had canned chili taste better than what they provided. 
Adult Mac & Cheese - a twist on overpriced cheese sticks. Lobster tacos - I didn't realize taco shells came in that small of a size. 

Service - it didn't exist. We sat in the lounge area of the bar where there are tables. The waitress moved a guy, there by himself, to sit a large group and then they ended up not being able to sit in the bar because of some being underage. They took the poor guys menu and never brought him his drink. We asked him to join us thinking his service would improve but all four of us ended up having very little to no service. 

My advice - don't waste your time as you will be greatly disappointed!

This is a staple of every one of our Vegas trips.  Sure, it's not fine cuisine and it's a little overpriced, but we always love what we eat there and it's one of the best people watching spots in the area.

We rarely venture into the entrees, usually just dining on an array of appetizers.  The adult mac & cheese is great (who couldn't love the over indulgence of dipping fried mac and cheese into truffled cheese sauce), the lobster tacos are delicious, and the Bobby Baldwin burgers are always a nice medium rare.  It's a prime location in Vegas, so if you fixate on the fact that the above 3 will run you ~$60+ due to location you'll be unhappy, but it's the Bellagio - of course it's overpriced.

Oh, and definitely sit in the outer tables of the bar area... it seems like every type of person who comes to Vegas walks by, and it makes for an entertaining people show while eating.

Fix is a totally hip and trendy bar and restaurant located in the Bellagio Hotel in Las Vegas.  It is right off the casino, and it is open to the casino so while you are enjoying your meal and enjoying your libation at the bar you can still feel like you are a part of the casino action.

The bar at Fix is very cool--very well stocked as they like the gamblers to stay a little sauced in Vegas-HA! 
The staff is very friendly and professional.  Fix is a hot spot for high rollers and celebrities so it behooves the staff to always be on top of their game.  

The food at Fix is excellent. It is mostly a seafood menu.  I had the giant scallops when I was there and it was delicious.   
It is on the pricey side, but as I mentioned before they cater to celebs so they try to keep it exclusive.  
I would eat there again, and it is especially fun with a group.

The food was okay.  The ambience was non-existent. Even though we had reservations, we still had to wait 15 minutes for our table, the noise level was so high conversation was impossible.  My husband is a donut afficianado - but these were truly disappointing.   The service was frankly terrible.  For the money we blew here (which was close to what we spent at Delmonicos which was fantastic) we left feeling gypped.  

There are far better place to eat and spend your money.

This was a chic, hip, place. My fiance and I stopped by before a show and it was fun sitting by the bar. 

We got the grown up mac and cheese, and the lobster tacos. Both amazing dishes except the lobster tacos were shockingly small. (We ordered another round). 

If you're really hungry, then I recommend another place because this place is better for a dive in for some fancy cocktails and appetizers. For the portions of the dishes, I would say that it's a bit overpriced but if you are more into the aura of a place than the food, then definitely stop by.

Dined here with co-workers while on a business trip in Vegas.

Our server was good, and he checked in on us at the right frequency IMO. The food we ate was good, but nothing really stood out. My fave bite (as we ordered a bunch of dishes to share) was probably the calamari or shrimp cocktail.

We also had a reservation (made weeks prior) but still had to wait 10 minutes to be seated. I don't necessarily mind waiting but we were with a member of our executive team so not ideal.

Perhaps we picked the wrong spot for a work dinner but the music and atmosphere were so loud it was literally hard to hear the person sitting next to you. Wouldn't recommend for an intimate date night spot.

Tip : when I checked in on Yelp, I got a free glass of sangria - YAY!!

What a delicious dinner!  Restaurant was crowded but service was excellent and quality of food was AMAZING!! 

We had shrimp cocktail for appetizer, I had fillet, hubby had grass fed New York steak.  We shared sides of asparagus and mushrooms.  Such an amazingly delicious dinner.

Ate here again and the chicken, pork chop and ribeye should be added to the list for good entrees.  Had the yellowtail sashimi appetizer and the fish was good quality, but nothing really special there.  Really fun place to eat.  One of the highlights of a great Memorial Day weekend.

Great restaurant and prices are not too bad either.  Gotta have the fried mac n cheese and chilli cheese fries!  Sliders were pretty good too.  Things you can skip, poke.  Things to know...the bathroom sink has a pretty strong current.  Turn it on slowly so you don't get wet!

I've been to FIX before, but I'd never before ordered just a steak. I decided now was the time, and ordered the sirloin.

I must say, it was one of the best (if not the best) steaks I can remember ever having. It was $43, but it was worth every dollar.

The only reason I don't feel like I can give it a 5 is because although we had 9:00 PM reservations, we didn't get our table until 9:20 PM. Every time we asked the hostesses about the availability of our table, we were told it would be ready "in a few moments." Maybe I'm a little hard on restaurants, but if I take the time to make reservations, I'd like that my table be ready within 5 minutes of my arrival if I'm on time.

The food, however, entirely made up for the initial service. Our server was great, as were the very adult mac and cheese sticks. If you love steak and have money to spend, don't pass up this restaurant.

I debated between giving this place 1/2 stars but aired on the side of kindness because I'm on vacation. The low rating not for the food, but for awful customer service. 

The food was decent - definitely overpriced, but hey you're in Las Vegas. I had the Greens salad and the maple apple cider vinaigrette was surprisingly refreshing and paired well with the goat cheese in the salad. I also tried the adult Mac & Cheese; tasty, but a little heavy on the truffle oil.

Now for customer service. Be warned: adding chicken to your salad will literally double the price of your meal. I kid you not, it was a $16 4 oz piece of chicken added to my $16 salad. Similarly, the waitress offered my friend another soda - which we later found was not a refill, but a new $4.50 soda. When we raised this to our waitress, she sent over the manager. To our shock and surprise when we raised these points to him, not once did he apologize but went further in regards to the chicken to reply "it can't just be complimentary". Yes, thank you... I've been to a restaurant before. Usually it's an addition, in other words, a part of your meal and NOT the same cost for a tiny piece of chicken. To the main point, this is not how you speak to customers and I would avoid this rude establishment.

Decided to stop here for a small/quick bite before the debauchery began. The restaurant is constructed entirely of Costa Rican wood which gives it a very dark mysterious feel to it. The Lil Wayne and Gucci Mane music on the other hand were not. I'm up for that music when I'm dancing in a nightclub, not when I'm eating my dinner.

Foodwise..they get a thumbs up! For an appetizer we got the lobster taco. Yummy, but you get 4 bite sized tacos for the hefty price of $22...not worth it. The $18 French Dip is worth every penny and then some! Best I've ever had! Thick slices of steak that melted in your mouth with every bite, sandwhiched between a soft chewy baguette. bread! 

Do not try any of the signature cocktails...We tried half the menu and they just got worse as we kept ordering.  Every single one of them is overloaded with simple syrup it's disgusting.
I just had one of the best steaks of my life.  The New Zealand bone in ribEye was a masterpiece.

Excellent service ans excellnt food.
At this,type of establishment i would have expected bread to be provided though.
The steak was perfect. And the atmosphere very good

This review is based on my experience below.
If u wanna experience heaven pls do what I did.
Go have fun at pool parties and come back to hotel semi drunk or buzzed. Be hungry. Order adult mac and cheese with truffle oil and eat them all while u are buzzed. You won't regret.

Pricey, pricey, pricey.

But the chicken wings and mac and cheese made it all better.

I've never had a chicken wing where I was able to consume every last bit of meat.  Ingenious method of preparation.  You'll just have to go yourself to see what I mean.

Oh, and the mac and cheese.  Isn't turning it into a Twinkie one of the miracles that Jesus performed?

I stopped here to get a pre-theater drink before attending the Cirque du Soleil show at the Bellagio. If you're looking for a pre-theater drink this is definitely a good place to go. It is very close to the theater and it is relatively empty between six and 7 o'clock.


I grabbed a seat at the bar and the wait staff were very friendly and very quick. The drinks I purchased were quite good and I would definitely go back and grab a drink at this bar.

They will give you tap water at the bar if you ask for it.
Amazing food, courteous staff. Well worth the money. Never had a steak so good. Love it
The food here is amazing.  We went for a bachelorette party and the food came out fast, was all amazing, loud music, fun atmosphere.

So I go in and sit at the bar.  I ask the bartender what the specials are...He isn't sure.  I ask him what are the house specialties.  He says,"people seem to like  the sliders"  He was not familiar with the menu at all.  I ask him how much is your belvanie "scotch"  He was not really sure, but threw out the number of $32 , and another bartender later said it was 24. ...but it was too late, I already ordered another drink that cost $26 that was on their menu, which I can't recall the name.  So I ordered a shrimp cocktail, and one of the shrimps was not deveined.   I also asked another bartender if  the Salmon was wild caught or farm raised.  She was unsure.  I mean come on, if you guys want to keep a 5 star, and "triple" AAA rating, you gotta train your bartenders better, so they understand the specials... you gotta make sure your food are prepped much better.  I was not really impressed.  I might give it another try when I go back to the Bellagio.  I rather go to Olives which is about 100 yards away.

We were really excited about the plans we had for the evening. We had decided to splurge on the "O" package which included VIP tix to the Cirque du Soleil O show and prix fixe dinner at FIX.  However, the horrible service at FIX ruined our evening.  Once we were seated at FIX and told the waitress we had the package her attitude became curt and unattentive.  She started pushing us to order drinks (which was not included in the prix frixe) and then got annoyed when we told her we were going to hold off until later to order drinks.  She didn't bother to come and check on us and we had to flag down the floater wait staff.   Overall, very surprised that an upscale restaurant like FIX would hire personnel that was so poor in customer service.
Dinner was also just ok, I think the package is gimmicky and ordering off the menu would have been a better experience.

We originally had reservations at Le Cirque, but they Le Sucked. 

So thankful Fix could accommodate us without reservations at the bar; we ordered their pre-theater menu. Much better ambiance than Le Cirque for diners under 60.

Great service from our cocktail server! The kale caesar and truffle penne pasta were both delicious! The portions are substantial for the value and we ended up taking the donuts home. 

Must get cocktails: Raspberry Sin* & Cucumber Martini!! Soooo good!

*eat a pinch of cotton candy before the cocktail dissolves all of it :)

When we're back at the Bellagio, we won't dine anywhere else. Highly recommend!

My husband and I stopped in for a quick bite before seeing O at the Bellagio. Pleasantly surprised by the food. We had shrimp, beef carpaccio, oysters and some sashimi. Everything was fresh and good. The waitress knew we were in a hurry and the food arrived quickly. I would go back for a more leisurely dinner.

It's a scene.  The place is usually packed and the music is LOUD.  That said, if you're looking for a fun place with great people watching, head over to Fix.  I like the Kobe chilli cheese fries and the poke.
My place to stop by when In Vegas I love everything in this restaurant everything in the menu is very good places very clean Services is unbelievable please walk in you guys don't have to regret

Food is mediocre and prices are too high for what felt more like a sampler than a dish.  $31 for three sliders in a small plate is ridiculous as was a piece of chicken for $42.
Also, they don't serve bread which doesn't seem very welcoming while you seat there waiting for your food to arrive.

Don't mind paying for  great food, but this was an expensive bad meal, with a small menu badly executed.

Could the decor & the damn-hot waitstaff be any more hotter? after seeing "Love by the Beatles", I sank into the plush booth and stared at the  wavy wooden ceiling above me. I'm all smiles until I got my cosmo. Too sweet! (so I guess I'm paying $13 for cranberry juice)  Their Midori sour was even worse.  Good thing the buffalo wings saved the day! (if you are a clean freak, you would love these wings)  They looked like "chicken
lollipops" -- the meat is already pulled away from the bone for you so you don't get your hands DIRTY! nice.

This place has a great atmosphere and ambiance for being in Vegas. My friend and I were talking about how one of the things we don't enjoy in Vegas is having dinner in a dead mall.  Most of the restaurants that we enjoy always end up being in the mall and of course, no life around what so ever, so during dinner, we'll be looking outside and there's no one. We're in Vegas! We want the life and the hustling of people outside!

Coming here wasn't planned. We have heard of FIX in Bellagio being a great restaurant and just knew that it was your typical American food. The birthday girl wanted some great American food and some meat!  So between FIX and Tao Restaurant, we decided to go with FIX.

Coming here, our wait wasn't long, but we did happen to make a quick reservations before coming.  We were seated in a nice little booth and then the menus were presented to us.  

The menu of course was a bit pricey and a little pricier than we had expected.  

The boyfriend and I got the pork and the other couple got the filet mignon.  

Both were delicious!  Omg!  Both were cooked to perfection!  The pork, we actually had that cooked medium and it was very tender, juicy and flavorful!  It's always a hit or miss for me with pork at restaurants, but FIX does it really well!

We also got some sides: mashed potatoes, fried mac and cheese and asparagus.  

The mashed potatoes were smoked mashed potatoes and it truly had a smokey flavor to it which was interesting.  The asparagus had a truffle sauce that accompanied it which made it 100x better!  The fried mac and cheese wasn't really my favorite. But the boyfriend reallllly liked it!

I wouldn't mind coming here again in the future! But of course, probably for an event.

I echo all of the other sentiments--it is really overpriced and merely average. 

First off, the restaurant looks pretty nice. Lots of dark wood that set a nice scene for dinner. A decent bar area with TVs and a small dining room.

I got a caesar salad split with my sister and then a flatbread for dinner. There was no way I was ordering a $50 main plate from this place. The caesar was very good, and for $16 or whatever it was, it should have been. The flatbread was like eating a pile of salt. I probably should have expected it since it had some prosciutto on it, but it was still way salty. I tried some tuna that my mom got which was really good and the margarita flatbread was certainly better than mine.

Service is very professional and impressive. Our waitress was very helpful and kind throughout the meal. There's just no way I would go back with the price tag and average food unless I was staying in The Bellagio and didn't want to venture outside the hotel.

Fix is the best place to grab sophisticated meal inside The Bellagio. Great atmosphere, beautiful décor, and exquisite entrées! I recommend trying the duck and waffles!  It is a modern and classy take on a old southern classic. If your in the Bellagio and need an amazing dinner before you big the night life scene I would check out fix. From the music, service, and food it is simply amazing! Definitely worthy of being in The 5 diamond Bellagio.

Looking for exciting fare that's sumptuous and unique? Go to FIX in the Bellagio. 
Rave about: Adult Mac & Cheese with sauce on the side 
Crispy pork shank
Corn bread 
Service

Get a table nearest to the casino and watch the cleavage stroll by.
FIX is best for a short snack and drinks.

The Short:
FIX wasn't in my original plan.  The style of the "wavy-wood-ceiling" really caught my eye, and this is one of the coolest looking lounges on the block.

* The Buffalo Wings were awesome.  The Fish Sticks were just blah OK.

* Yea the prices were ridiculous and the service was a bit aloof, but that's just how it is on the main strip of Vegas.

* Three cheers for the bathroom attendant making sure everyone's FIX experience was a clean seated one.

* The bar area gets pretty busy, and there's likely a few drunks around (more likely dudes than chicks).

* The edge seating has the best view of silicone and the scantily clad.
Wow, so impressed! Ordered the Surf & Turf and the Scallops Benedict. Perfect portion, lots of meat and oh-so flavorful! Will definitely be back!

This is a hard review because there were elements I really loved. First of all, I was served the finest scallop dish I have ever had. The heavenly combination of scallops and crab sauce over tiny potato pancakes was perfection. Very rich but clean and fresh tasting.

My dinner companion had a lovely veal chop and lobster mashed potatoes. She loved her dinner and said it was very filling.
She sampled a few wines before settling on a Jordan Cabernet. She loved that, too.

We shared the banana doughnuts with insipid dipping sauce. This was a rancid tasting, stomach clenching mistake. 
Even though much of it was left, no one really seemed to care.
This wasn't the worst part of the evening...

After we were seated, a couple sat down at the next table. They had clearly been fighting for a while and the food and wine didn't help things. It was beyond awkward. At one point, the man placed himself between our two tables and continued the argument that was both personal and pornographic. It was awful and didn't let up until he got up and left.

It was very disturbing. I have a bit of claustrophobia and as I had no clear path out and my breathing space impaired, I started to feel lightheaded.

The manager should have been sensitive to the situation and either moved them or us. All I could think of was how to breathe with all of this going on. The throbbing and ultra loud music didn't help matters.

We thought this would be the finest meal at the Bellagio but it was a terrible experience.

Best restaurant my girlfriend and I ate at during our week long vacation in Vegas. We celebrated our anniversary here and they took every opportunity to congratulate us. I made reservations ahead on OpenTable, but it wasn't necessary since the restaurant wasn't too crowded when we arrived on Monday night. Upon arrival, we were promptly seated and greeted by Tom. He was very insightful and knew the menu like the back of his hand. He recommended to us his favorite items, which is always appreciated. We started off with the Adult Mac and Cheese, which to my surprise, doesn't come as a typical Mac n Cheese dish. They dish was fried like chicken fingers and there was a cheese sauce that accompanied it. It was a bit heavy being fried and dipped in cheese, but that's what I was expecting. For our entree, we ordered the SeaBass Risotto w/ lobster broth and Scallops benedict with potato cake. Let me just say, WOW. Both dishes were superb. The risotto was soft, creamy, and savory. The seabass was cooked to perfection with a crispy skin on top. The fish wasn't overcooked or chewy and was very fragile. The scallops was cooked nicely with a crisp on one side. It wasn't bitter, but flavorful with soft scallop meat. It was drizzled with crab hollandaise sauce. It didn't taste like breakfast, but a hearty dinner. To finish off the night, we were given complimentary champagne while eating Tiramisu Trifle. The trifle wasn't too sweet and had just the right amount of cream and lady fingers. The cup was big like a Sunday, but manageable. Throughout the whole night, there were three waiters who consistently check on us to ask how the dinner was. The bill came out to be around $150, which is pricey but is warranted by the location in the Bellagio and great service. This place is truly a gem and is underrated since there are so many other restaurants here.

We were going to try Spago right down the hall, but something made us go back to Fix, whose menu we had looked at right before. I think it may have been the atmosphere as well as the menu.

Both beckoned with a variety of interesting choices and wonderful presentation, and we were not disappointed. I ended up choosing the three-course fixed-price menu which offered a great choice for pescatarians and meat-eaters alike.

I was equally interested in the donuts for desert. I hadn't seen something like that as a menu choice before. Couldn't I just go to Crispy-Creme after dinner?

For starters I had the Tomato soup, which I have to say was one of the best I have had. They included a spicy focaccia, which had a rich mozzarella sandwiched in-between and cooked bell peppers. Fabulous.

Main course: Surf and Turf. Hard to do this wrong and they didn't, but the steak was nice and carmelized on the outside and cooked perfectly on the outside. Shrimp were nice and crisp, and a perfect portion of scalloped potatoes rounded it out.

Then the donuts. Sublime. I was skeptical but dayum. I'm sure you have seen some of the photos. They come out on a glass skewer and you get to dip them in a chocolate or vanilla sauce. Very decadent. 

I would definitely recommend picking from their extensive wine and spirits list, they have a pretty cool iPad interface that offers a wide spectrum. It was pretty great to chose some local craft brews to get the meal started.

All in all, my stay at the Bellagio was just average. But my meal at FIX was pretty epic. Check them out, and the prices were terrific for the quality of food you get!

This is by far my favorite place to dine! The food is amazingly good and service is on point. Their drink menu has a huge variety and their food is different. They have a tuna appetizer that is served on a "rice crispy". Def a must try!
Don't come here unless you have time to waste. From the time we got here it took about 2 hours till we got our food

Stayed at the Bellagio over Memorial Day Weekend. Fix was able to accommodate my girlfriend and I on multiple occasions with no waiting. We sat at the bar and had amazing service from Sisco (sorry if the spelling is wrong), Heather, and Shane. Very inviting staff and great menu and cocktail options.

49.00 for 12 ounce steak and it does not come with side orders. 3 small egg roll for 18.00. hey, isn't that cost more than macdonald french fries?  this place is not good for nonsmokers. smoke from casino goes straight to the restaurant. we smell like smokers  and my eyes turn red when we left.our bills for 2 persons was 234.00 without alcohol. now i know why the owner drive a lamborghini

We went here for our last dinner in Vegas. We ordered the chilli cheese fries and macaroni and cheese for appetizers. YUM-O! I LOVED the way they presented the fries, chilli and cheese separately. Very fun! 

I ordered the scallops --OMG SO FREAKIN GOOD! When the plate came out with 5 scallops on my plate, I have to admit that I was a little disappointed. However, the food was filling, delicious and beautiful! Definitely give this a try if you love scallops and bacon!

My boyfriend ordered a steak and loved it too. Much better than the other steakhouse we went to!

The service was excellent! When my friend stood up and went to the restroom, a waiter came up to the table and folded her napkin and placed it on the table. Our glasses were always full and the staff was extremely attentive. I would definitely go back for more!

My girl friends and I were staying at Bellagio and agreed to have a comped dinner at FIX before going to our Bottle Service Reservations at The Bank Nightclub later that night, all provided by our wonderful Light Group VIP Host. It was a nice atmosphere and a perfect stop before a long night out. The steak tasted better than most of the other upscale steakhouses I've been to. My girl friends all agreed that the food was absolutely delicious and service was great. We will definitely be back again!

It was A LOT of money for nothing that was too impressive!  I spent $250.00 for a dinner for two and it was probably worth $120.00 at the most.  The service started out great but at the end of the night when I needed my check because I was going to the "O" show my waitress looked irritated that I asked her for the check.  She had disappeared for almost 20 minutes prior to my asking.  We were already there for one hour and 40 minutes.  How much time do you need to eat???

For this price, treat yourself right and eat at Prime (a steakhouse that is also located in the Bellagio as well).  ALSO...I saw a really good deal at "Brand" another one of the Lighthouse Group Restaurants in the Monte Carlo.  They had a steak dinner for two for around $90.00!  Give that a try instead, but I won't be back here again!

Ode to a S'more...
Creamy cup of pudding
Graham cracker crumble
Toasted 'mallow fluff
Nectar from the Gods

If you love the joy of s'mores and know that you must exist on a plane of existence that exalts the lowly campfire treat to a level of modernized miracle greatness, then please go visit FIX for dessert.  They say they're known for their donuts (stuffed with banana cream and served with chocolate and peanut butter sauces), but I know better.  I know in the goodness of all that is holy in my soul that the s'mores cup is where it's at.  

Also?  Sliders are pretty bomb (even if they are $29).  Service here is good when it's empty, eh when it's not.  Always delicious, and always on the pricey side.  Still pretty worth it.

The staff is great.  Server was friendly, the Manger was professional, the food just isn't that good.  The $400 I spent there for two people to dine was totally ridiculous.  The roasted potatoes were awful, the steaks wasn't even close to the temp I ordered, frankly you can get a better steak at Outback than you can here, and it won't cost you $70!  With all the options for high-end dining in Vegas, this place should be an option out of desperation.  I could go on about how terrible the food is here, but the bottom line is that the Bellagio should be embarrassed to have this place in their hotel.  I'm sorry, but if you're going to charge $50 - $100 for a steak, you better be able to cook the darn thing properly.  Your pork belly steam buns shouldn't taste like you purchased them at Sam's or Costco and nuked them to order, your "shaved seasonal vegetable salad" shouldn't be 6 pieces of shaved radish and a couple pieces of carrot.  This place is a total rip off.  Don't get me wrong, the manager comped my steak when he saw it, as he should have, but you can do so much better dining in Vegas than this place.  The server and Manger were great, that's why they get 2 stars,  the food is on par with Golden Coral, just 500% more expensive.

I wanted to like them.  But on several levels they just seemed to miss the mark.  The female staff was clearly hired because they're easy on the eyes, but some of those girls were dumber than a box a cheap plastic fake hair at the Korean beauty supply shop.  Considering the prices, the service was not up to par.  I've gotten better service at places where the entrees were a third of the price.  

Also, the lighting is dark.  Is it weird that I like to see my food?  I had food here with a friend, then others in our group met us for drinks.  Sadly even though we told the host we were expecting others our friends still had problems communicating that to the host and finding us.

My recommendation - this is a places to head for lounging more than munching.  It was easy to actually have a conversation and hang out.
Went there last night got the lobster tacos and they so small.... Also the size of a half dollar. Service was meh will neve go back

It was a dessert night for us, and I'm so pleased we went to FIX! The service was amazing. We tried the Espresso Martini... I was in love with the first sip. Then, the variety of desserts were just incredible. The S'mores, banana filled donuts with peanut butter dipping sauce, the cookie crème brûlée, and the ice cream pops... All so amazing!! Can't wait to go back for dinner!

The Fix is a nice place to grab a seat and people watch if you're waiting on something or someone at the Bellagio.  I tried their cucumber martini and it was delicious.  

Service, however, while nice to look at, was not so great.  The girls were quick with the menus when you sat down but then forgetful about the details.  Also, drink prices were up to new Vegas standards... about $15 a drink.

It is what it is... an expensive highend casino bar.  I liked my drink, which is what's most important.

Might see ya there.

My boyfriend and I are staying at the Bellagio. We were recommended this place, but will definitely not be back. To summarize the restaurants food selection, it is bland, dry and not enticing. 

For our drink selection, I ordered the well-known Jordyn Cabernet, which was one of two items that we completed fully from our meal. 

We ordered the shrimp cocktail, which was average without horseradish served with the dish. Next the kale salad came which was pretty good. (Keep in mind that every kale salad tastes pretty much the same across the board.) 

For our entrees we ordered the 8 oz filet and the sea bass. Much to our surprise, the filet was very dry, even drenched in their 2 house sauces... The sea bass was bland and tasteless in a lobster reduction. Of course, we ordered two sides for our lovely meal thus far: asparagus & truffle mac & cheese. Let me leave my review and thoughts at this, the asparagus was the best part of our dining experiences.
This place is always great. Service was good, food was excellent. Vegas is full of amazing restaurants, and this is 1 of them. Oh yeah, adult mac and cheese...CHECK!

FIX is a dark and intimate high-end American restaurant in the Bellagio. I've come here now twice with my partner and have been pleased by some of the dishes but not overly wow'd. The service here is top notch and so is the interior and decor, I just wish it wasn't so dimly lit (really hard to take photos in here). 

Favorites of the Night**
My favorite ended up being one of the more affordable items on the menu, which was the mac and cheese bites- perfectly breaded and fried on the outside with a perfectly gooey center. 
The Lobster Tacos had a very delicious filling that paired well with the avocado crema on the side, and the Tuna Tartare was also tasty. For both of these, however the portion sizes were too small for my liking. 
The Scallops Benedict was equally good, but I felt the scallop itself was too chewy and not seasoned enough. It was also interesting that the Benedict base was also chewy, a mochi consistency, that didn't pair well with the scallop. 
I loved the FIX Creme Brûlée. The flavor was rich and decadent, and it honestly was one of the best i've had. 

Not so Favorite*
I did not personally like the Shrimp and Sausage Flatbread since the meats and flavors just didn't work well together. It was also on the more bland side. The Wagyu Skirt Steak also was lacking in something as well. I feel like it needed a sauce or some side veggies, etc. to elevate it. 

The Smore's Cake was my least favorite dish of the night. The cake itself was very dry and crumbly. The only redeeming part of this dessert was the ice cream. 

This is a decent place to dine if you are at the Bellagio, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

The food here is not so great, but our server was very accommodating. We were in a bit of a rush, so our server made sure we got out of there on time for our next event.   Half of us really enjoyed the food and the other half said their food was blah. I ordered the salmon, asparagus and calamari, none of them were good. How can you mess up asparagus? Lol... Cheesecake Factory is way better.

Over rated and over priced. This is not a $$$, it's really a $$$$ restaurant. It's incredibly loud, in fact the bass actually rumbles your seat like at a live concert venue. 

The food was good but forgettable. I have to admit I dined at Range in SF the same week where we paid about half as much (it's Michelin star) and the food was twice as good. 

The service was relatively snappy although there were pacing issues at the beginning. About 1/3 of the way through the meal the servers got it back together at which point everything was right on. They're certainly nice enough, but did nothing memorable - I also felt their wine knowledge was a bit rehearsed as opposed to experienced. 

The restaurant itself is tucked next to the Casino in the Bellagio, which means if you sit near the exterior of it your looking out onto the casino, which isn't a memorable view if you ask me. The restaurant across the casino, called something Fish (yellow fish maybe? I can't remember) has views of the fountains outside (although the service there was much much worse). 

But I guess this is Vegas, and this is what people expect. We were with someone from LA and she said FIX reminded her of good LA restaurants... which just makes me appreciate SF even more.

In 15 years of going to Las Vegas, this is about the worst meal I've ever had.

Here's my experience, in convenient list format
1) 9pm reservation - we sat at 10:15pm.  Seriously.  They blamed OpenTable, whatever.  At the end of the day, if they knew there were problems, how come nobody contacted us? RIDICULOUS.

2) Prices - $44 for a piece of fish or chicken? Really? I've been to top restaurants in LV, NYC, SF, etc, and while I've seen expensive food, it comes along with... amazing service, uber-fresh ingredients, creative menus, etc.  This was just ripoff central.

3) Food quality - my seabass was bland, as in had less flavor than microwaveable fish sticks.  One person in our party sent their food back!  Chicken was dried out, sides were meh.  The "bright spot" was the appetizers, which I cannot recall even a few days later, so probably not too bright.

4) Ambiance - eh, it was "fine".  Nothing special, no great decor, nothing revolutionary.  

5) Service was decent, they kept glasses full, etc.  Again, not amazing (no synchronized food delivery for example), just average.  Nothing to justify the cost of the meal.

The entire group walked out very disappointed.  Wouldn't go back, wouldn't recommend, wouldn't do anything ever again.  Maybe they call it Fix because it still needs to be fixed?

Dined here yesterday for a work outing. The food, cocktails,  and the service was phenomenal! The ambiance of this place is romantic and upscale. I recommend the chef's choice oysters, the Korean Tuna tartare, crispy rock shrimp, lobster tacos, and the wood grilled tomahawk ribye. 

For starters the lobster tacos and Korean Tuna Tartare are excellent choices! The Wood-grilled tomahawk ribye was definitely different from other steak houses, as not all steak house cook their stake in wood fire. 

For dessert, I recommend the Creme Brulee with candied pecans and bacon!!

For Cocktails, I recommend the Red Dragon and the Pineapple Mojito!

ENJOY!

Bellagio messed up our reservation for 12 at Prime and instead said we had them at Fix. Came here after a networking event and exhausting day of workshops - for a work dinner. Loved the Kobe Beef Chili. The Hamachi Jalapeno Sashimi was sliced too thin in my opinion. 

Seabass - very good - but I've definitely still had better. Ribeye was very good although I still think it wasn't amazing. Good cocktail - Cucumber Martini. Good casual dinner - not a fan of the lighting but good times with some coworkers.

I had high hopes but our meal here was just ok.  The adult mac and cheese is just way to rich and the texture of the mac and cheese gets lost.  The scallops we had were sandy.  Hard to imagine $40 scallops being gritty but they were.  If we weren't running late for a show I would have returned them.  Filet mignon was very good as was the lobster tacos.  The doughnuts we had for dessert were undercooked on the inside and a bit doughy.  I am sure it is hard to get them just right with the filling but they were a big disappointment.  There are so many great places to eat in Vegas.  We won't be going here again.  ps. but  the wait staff was great.

The food was pretty decent, but the service pre-seating was horrible even with a reservation, and it is WAY over priced. 

We started with smoked salmon and caviar poppers. The cream cheese on this was nasty. 

Then moved onto Kobe sliders and fries as a side. Can I just say that it was just a plain mini burger with fries? Grounding up Kobe beef is not how one should have it... if that even was Kobe beef. I think the only reason we all enjoyed it was because we were so hungry. 

Next was a little bit of salad. Split amongst 10 hungry girls were 3 plates of salad...

Then came the Yellowtail Sashimi which was this absolutely delicious piece of thin yellowtail in this jalapeno ponzo sauce. 

But the thing that all made it worth it was the Sea Bass, served over risotto, with baby shrimp and topped off by lobster broth. It was totally moist and delightful. 

For dessert there was fried macaroni and cheese and donuts. Can I say, since when does donut = fancy restaurant dessert. Obviously the chef was getting lazy when he got to the dessert menu. And usually that's the best part. We were so full however that we happily skipped the donuts and mac & cheese.

2 stars for the seafood items alone!

One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas! I've had everything on the menu and there isn't a single thing that I don't like. I usually come here with friends and we order a bunch of appetizers and dishes so that we can share and taste a little bit of everything.

Must trys are: Lobster Tacos, Bobby Baldwin Burgers, Spicy Tuna, Adult Mac N Cheese, BLT Crab Cakes. All of their food sounds like stuff you've heard of or tried before but they add twists to their dishes that takes it to another level that you've never tasted.

The restaurant doesn't have a fourth wall (besides a hip level wall/divider) so it basically opens into the casino... which makes for great people watching if you sit on the outskirts of the restaurant. The feel is hip, trendy, sexy (its Vegas after all) and has a constant beat of ongoing music.

They do take reservations but the bar and lounge is open seating and provides about 10-13 small tables and booths, plus seating at the bar so you can usually find somewhere to squeeze in even during busy times.

My mom and I went to Fix @ Bellagio with high hopes prior to seeing "O". Sadly, the food and drinks are mediocre and insanely overpriced, and the menu descriptions are ridiculously inaccurate. Take your money and go over to The Cosmo restaurants where you at least get what you pay for. 

First, I ordered the red sangria which tasted like it had a foot marinating in it. I don't know what red wine they used, but it was nasty. I sent it back and ordered a champagne cocktail which was just ok, and certainly not worth the $20 price tag. I'm not sure I've ever paid that much for a drink, even in the SF Bay Area where I live. 

Second, we ordered the fried mozzarella -- I'm expecting something along the lines of fancy fried cheese sticks, but what came out was a big ball of mozzarella wrapped in phyllo dough sitting in tomato sauce. That was fine, but the strange thing was there was no bread/crostini/etc to put the cheese on. Do they expect people to shovel hunks of straight up melted mozzarella into their mouths? It was just weird. I asked for bread so we had something to put the cheese on, and they delivered dinner rolls. Again, weird, but I suppose it's better than eating straight melted cheese by itself. 

Third, we ordered the adult Mac and cheese. Nowhere does the description on the menu say it's fried, and out comes fried macaroni and cheese "sticks." They were ok (and honestly reminded me of something off a kids menu, which is ironic given their name), but I wasn't intending to order two fried dishes which was annoying. I'm also wondering who the heck wrote the menu and why they don't just give accurate descriptions of the food they're serving. 

Finally, we have the Kobe chili cheese fries. We get a stack of something that's supposed to be fries and a little pot of chili. It was boring. We were sad. At this point we gave up and stopped ordering.

I regret that I spent $112 after tip for a meal that was not any better than one I could have gotten at TGI Friday's.
raspberry sin! overall awesome! calamari delicious, organic ny steak very juicy yummmmmy loaded bake potato was great only downfall it's noisy!

Boyfriend and I had a wonderful dinner here before catching O.  He got the NY Sirloin and I got the sea bass with creamed spinach and mashed potatoes as our sides.  The sea bass came on a bed of risotto and it was perfectly cooked!  The service was fabulous and we definitely enjoyed our meal and dining experience.

The service was mediocre, although the mgr comped part of the bill due to slow food. My husband arrived at least 20min ahead and ordered a couple of things it took almost 40-50mins for his order to arrive. We got there ordered a few items and they came faster than his, hence the comp from the mgr. He made a modification to the slider and it came out wrong. The fried mac & cheese bars weren't worth it, the truffle oil is too strong. The burratta was AMAZING!!! Wrapped in phyllo and fried, yummy!!! The crab cake poppers were ok, but the gravy underneath was tasteless and sparse. Creamed spinach was ok, crispy tuna was ok, spiced fries didn't really have any spice to them. Wouldn't try again.

I loved fix, I came here for the first time Sunday night! We were a group of 8 so we had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated at 8:45 PM. The restaurant is located in the bellagio, it's black and red, dimly lit and offers bar, table, and high top seating. The service is excellent and the menu is even better! 

There was a lot of us so we all ordered a bunch of apps to share; the crispy calamari, crispy jumbo shrimp, miso crusted slab bacon, the lobster tacos, and the ultimate mac & cheese. I can't even begin to tell you which one I liked the most because they were all equally finger-licking-good. The shrimp and the calamari were super crispy, tasty, and fresh; the shrimp came in this wasabi aioli that was the perfect amount of spice it paired so well with the shrimp which was fried perfectly; the calamari fried perfectly as well came with two dipping sauces a creamy ponzu (similar to tartar but better) and a sweet thai chilli sauce, both were so different yet so good, my favorite was the thai chilli. The miso bacon is on another level, it was a thick piece of bacon with assorted veggies in a yuzu basil sauce that was unreal, the dish was sweet and savory, I've never had such an elegant piece of bacon- the flavor was off the charts! The lobster tacos are miniature, they def will not fill up one person let alone two it's best to order and additional app with this one. The ultimate mac and cheese came out like a mozzarella stick, accompanied by a cheesey/buttery dipping sauce, I couldn't enjoy this as much I wanted to because I was so full, but I did force down one stick and it was worth it! If you like deep fried cheese and macaroni get this!

For a starter, I had the mixed green salad which was super fresh, tossed in a light dressing, it was delish. I would not get this or any salad as a main it will not fill you up, this is perfect to start. For my main course I ordered the Wood Grilled Chicken; sunchoke puree, sauteed artichokes, shaved asparagus, and lemon jus. It was delicious, my chicken was tender and juicy and on the bone, it was packed with flavor and the side of veggies were sauteed to perfection and dressed lightly with olive oil and lemon. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and so did my group, I def recommend this!
noisy - steak cold - very expensive for a casino restaurant that is open to teh casino floor
Great food, suggest sharing. Adult Mac and cheese is phenomenal, spicy tuna was amazing. Chicken wings, chili fries and bone in ribeye all winners.

This was the second time we've eaten here. Went here for a late dinner. Dinner and drinks were amazing. I had the prime rib pork chop and was totally blown away. The portion was huge so maybe good to share. Bacon wrapped pork chop with jalapeños cream corn. You won't be disappointed. A little pricey but well worth it.

Obsessed with fix! Was in Vegas for virtuoso travel week. Great drinks, and a really nice ambiance. Heather the bartender was so polite and sweet. I would come back specifically for her:) check it out!

One of the best rib-eyes I've had in a while!  The Mac N Cheese is not your standard mac n cheese, but it comes out looking like a cheese stick.  Cheesy and so delicious!  The Lobster Mash, although not Mastro's, but it was still very flavorful.  Service was pleasant.  I will absolutely be back!

Little price e but the food was fantastic I tried the bone stake and see bass fish and was really good. Oh the tomato soup was awesome. The waiter and boss boys were very nice and on time its one of a kind. I guess you get what you pay ;)
Recommended? Yes absolutely. Remember it's a little expensive but worthed.

My boyfriend surprised me with a Valentine's Day reservation at Fix and I was thrilled because I saw so many great reviews about this restaurant. We were a few minutes late to our reservation and they still seated us immediately and were incredibly nice about the whole thing. As soon as we sat down the hostess was so nice and made some small talk and jokes with us which we appreciated, we love people with a good sense of humor. Then our waiter approached us with an incredibly friendly smile. His name was Devon and he told us right off the bat that it would be him and 2 other guys serving us tonight. So we had some questions about drinks and I had seen on yelp to get the raspberry sin and he was honest with me that it was a really sweet drink, but I still wanted to try it. So he brings out the martini glass that has a heap of cotton candy in it and waited so I could record the whole process of him pouring the drink in to make the concoction, so nice of him to do that. For our appetizer we ordered the lobster tacos and calamari. Both were simply amazing. We mainly had Devon asking how everything was going and explaining our meals but there was one other guy helping us who was also so helpful and nice. For the main dish I ordered the filet mignon and my boyfriend ordered the pork chop wrapped in bacon. Absolutely phenomenal. Everything was cooked perfectly.
